dataitem.name: Data Source Identifier
dataitem.definition: Identification of the radar station from which the data is received.

field.name: SAC
field.desc: System Area Code fixed to zero

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the Eurocontrol Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int/asterix).

dataitem.name: Target Report Descriptor
dataitem.definition: Type and properties of the target report.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
• For Mode S aircraft, the SPI information is also contained in I007/230.
• To bits 3/2 (FOE/FRI): IFF interrogators supporting a three level classification of the processing of the Mode 4 interrogation result shall encode the detailed response information in data item M4E of the Reserved Expansion Field of category 048. In this case the value for FOE/FRI in I007/020 shall be set to “00”.

dataitem.name: Data Source Identifier
dataitem.definition: Identification of the radar station to which the data is sent.

field.name: SAC
field.desc: System Area Code fixed to zero

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the Eurocontrol Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int/asterix).

dataitem.name: Warning/Error Conditions
dataitem.definition: Warning/error conditions detected by a radar station for the target report involved.

field.name: W/E Value
field.enum: Slow moving target correlated with road infrastructure (terrestrial vehicle)
Mode C code / Mode S altitude code abnormal value compared to the track
Maximum Doppler Response in Zero Filter
Duplicated or Illegal Mode S Aircraft Address
Undecodable Mode C code / Mode S altitude code
Mode 1 was present in original reply
Mode 2 was present in original reply
Plot potentially caused by Wind Turbine
Ambiguous acknowledge, duplicated request for same Mode S address
Ambiguous acknowledge, duplicated request for same track number
Reject, too many parallel requests (exceeds system parameter for maximum number of requests per scan

dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. It has to be stressed that a series of one or more W/E conditions can be reported per messa.
2. Data conveyed in this item for target reports are of secondary importance, and can generally also be derived from the processing of mandatory items.
3. Definitions can be found in SUR.ET1.ST03.1000-STD-01-01 Radar Sensor Performance Analysis.
4. Warning/Error codes of 64 and higher are reserved for Directed Interrogation messages.

dataitem.name: Measured Position in Polar Co-ordinates
dataitem.description: Measured position of an aircraft in local polar co-ordinates.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. In case of no detection, the extrapolated position expressed in slant polar co-ordinates may be sent, except for a track cancellation message. No detection is signalled by the TYP field set to zero in I007/020 Target Report Descriptor.
2. This item represents the measured target position of the plot, even if associated with a track, for the present antenna scan. It is expressed in polar co-ordinates in the local reference system, centred on the radar station.
3. In case of combined detection by a PSR and an SSR, then the SSR position is sent.

dataitem.name: Calculated Position in Cartesian Co-ordinates
dataitem.definition: Calculated Position of an aircraft in Cartesian co-ordinates.

dataitem.name: Mode-2 Code in Octal Representation
dataitem.definition: Reply to Mode-2 interrogation.

field.name: L
field.enum: Mode-2 code as derived from the reply of the transponder
Smoothed Mode-2 code as provided by a local tracker

dataitem.desc:
Encoding Rule:
This item is optional. When used, it shall be sent when :
• Mode 2 is present. Then, it represents the Mode 2 code for the plot, even if associated with a track.
• Mode 2 is absent and local tracking is performed. It shall then be sent with the bit-14 (L) set to one.
NOTE
Bit 15 has no meaning in the case of a smoothed Mode-2 and is set to 0 for a calculated track.

dataitem.name: Mode-1 Code in Octal Representation
dataitem.definition: Reply to Mode-1 interrogation.

field.name: L
field.enum: Mode-1 code as derived from the reply of the transponder
Smoothed Mode-1 code as provided by a local tracker

dataitem.desc:
Encoding Rule:
This item is optional. When used, it shall be sent when :
• Mode 1 is present. Then, it represents the Mode 1 code for the plot, even if associated with a track.
• Mode 1 is absent and local tracking is performed. It shall then be sent with the bit-6 (L) set to one.
NOTE
Bit 7 has no meaning in the case of a smoothed Mode-1 and is set to 0 for a calculated track.

dataitem.name: Mode-2 Code Confidence Indicator
dataitem.definition: Confidence level for each bit of a Mode-2 reply as provided by a monopulse SSR station.

field.name: QXi
field.desc:
= 0 High quality pulse Xi
= 1 Low quality pulse Xi

dataitem.desc:
Encoding Rule:
This data item is optional.
When used, it shall be transmitted only when at least one pulse is of low quality. It represents the confidence level for each reply bit of the Mode 2 code of the plot.

dataitem.name: Mode-1 Code Confidence Indicator
dataitem.definition: Confidence level for each bit of a Mode-1 reply as provided by a monopulse SSR station.

field.name: QXi
field.desc:
= 0 High quality pulse Xi
= 1 Low quality pulse Xi

dataitem.desc:
Encoding Rule:
This data item is optional.
When used, it shall be transmitted only when at least one pulse is of low quality. It represents the confidence level for each reply bit of the Mode 1 code of the plot.

dataitem.name: Mode-3/A Code in Octal Representation
dataitem.definition: Mode-3/A code converted into octal representation.

field.name: L
field.enum: Mode-3/A code derived from the reply of the transponder
Mode-3/A code not extracted during the last scan

dataitem.desc:
Encoding Rule:
• When Mode-3/A code is present, this item shall be sent. Then, it represents the Mode-3/A code for the plot, even if associated with a track.
• When Mode-3/A code is absent and local tracking is performed, it shall be sent with the bit-14 (L) set to one.
• For Mode S, once a Mode-3/A code is seen, that code shall be sent every scan, provided the radar is receiving replies for that aircraft.
NOTES
1. Bit 15 has no meaning in the case of a smoothed Mode-3/A code and is set to 0 for a calculated track. For Mode S, it is set to one when an error correction has been attempted.
2. For Mode S, bit 16 is normally set to zero, but can exceptionally be set to one to indicate a non-validated Mode-3/A code (e.g. alert condition detected, but new Mode-3/A code not successfully extracted).

dataitem.name: Mode-3/A Code Confidence Indicator
dataitem.definition: Confidence level for each bit of a Mode-3/A reply as provided by a monopulse SSR station.

field.name: QXi
field.desc:
= 0 High quality pulse Xi
= 1 Low quality pulse Xi

dataitem.desc:
Encoding Rule:
This data item is optional.
When used, it shall be transmitted only when at least one pulse is of low quality. It represents the confidence level for each reply bit of the Mode-3/A code of the plot.

dataitem.name: Mode 5, Extended Mode 1 and X-Pulse
dataitem.definition: Information from Mode 5 interrogations, extended Mode 1 or X-Pulse Presence.

subfield.name: Mode 5 Summary

field.name: DA
field.enum: No authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report
Authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report (i.e any valid Mode 5 reply type other than ID)

field.name: M1
field.enum: Mode 1 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply

field.name: M2
field.enum: Mode 2 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply

field.name: M3
field.enum: Mode 3 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply

field.name: MC
field.enum: Mode C code not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode C code from Mode 5 reply.

subfield.desc:
Note
1. The flags M2, M3, MC refer to the contents of data items I048/050, I048/070 and I048/090 respectively. The flag M1 refers to the contents of data item I048/055, Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation, and to the contents of the Subfield #5 (Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation).
2. If an authenticated Mode 5 reply is received with the Emergency bit set, then the Military Emergency bit (ME) in Data Item I048/020, Target Report Descriptor, shall be set.
3. If an authenticated Mode 5 reply is received with the Identification of Position bit set, then the Special Position Identification bit (SPI) in Data Item I048/020, Target Report Descriptor, shall be set.

subfield.name: Mode 5 Reported Position

field.name: Latitude
field.desc:
In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -90 ≤ latitude ≤ 90 deg. LSB = 180/2^23 degrees
Sign convention: North is positive.

field.name: Longitude
field.desc:
In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -180 ≤ latitude < 180 deg. LSB = 180/2^23 degrees = 2.145767*10^-05
Sign convention: East is positive.

subfield.desc:
Note
The resolution implied by the LSB is better than the resolution with which Mode 5 position reports are transmitted from aircraft transponders using currently defined formats.

subfield.name: Mode 5 GNSS-derived Altitude

field.name: RES
field.desc: Resolution with which the GNSS-derived Altitude (GA) is reported.

field.name: GA
field.desc: GNSS-derived ellipsoid. Altitude of target, expressed as height above WGS 84

subfield.desc:
NOTES
1. GA is coded as a 14-bit two’s complement binary number with an LSB of 25 ft. irrespective of the setting of RES.
2. The minimum value of GA that can be reported is -1000 ft.

subfield.name: Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation

field.name: EM1
field.desc: Extended Mode 1 Code in octal representation

subfield.desc:
NOTES
If Subfield #1 is present, the M1 bit in Subfield #1 indicates whether the Extended Mode 1 Code is from a Mode 5 reply or a Mode 1 reply. If Subfield #1 is not present, the Extended Mode 1 Code is from a Mode 1 reply.

subfield.name: Time Offset for POS and GA

field.name: TOS
field.desc: Time Offset coded as a twos complement number with an LSB of 1/128 s. The time at which the Mode 5 Reported Position (Subfield #3) and Mode 5 GNSS-derived Altitude (Subfield #4) are valid is given by Time of Day (I048/140) plus Time Offset.

subfield.desc:
NOTES
TOS shall be assumed to be zero if Subfield #6 is not present.

field.name: X5
field.desc: X-pulse from Mode 5 Data reply or Report.
field.enum: X-pulse set to zero or no authenticated Data reply or Report received.

field.name: XC
field.enum: X-pulse set to zero or no Mode C reply

field.name: X3
field.enum: X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 3/A reply

field.name: X2
field.enum: X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 2 reply

field.name: X1
field.enum: X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 1 reply

dataitem.desc:
When used to transmit MD5, it shall be sent when at least one of the following conditions is satisfied:
1. The target represented by the Monoradar Target Report has been interrogated in Mode 5.
2. A non-zero Extended Mode 1 Code is received.
3. An X-pulse is present. If condition 1 is satisfied, then Subfield #1 (Mode 5 Summary) shall be present.
If condition 2 is satisfied then Subfield #5 (Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation) shall be present.
If condition 3 is satisfied, then Subfield #7 (X Pulse Presence) shall be present.

dataitem.name: Flight Level in Binary Representation
dataitem.definition: Flight Level converted into binary representation.
dataitem.desc:
Encoding Rule:
This data item shall be sent when Mode C code or Mode S altitude code is present and decodable. It represents the flight level of the plot, even if associated with a track.
NOTES
1. When Mode C code / Mode S altitude code is present but not decodable, the “Undecodable Mode C code / Mode S altitude code” Warning/Error should be sent in I007/030.
2. When local tracking is applied and the received Mode C code / Mode S altitude code corresponds to an abnormal value (the variation with the previous plot is estimated too important by the tracker), the “Mode C code / Mode S altitude code abnormal value compared to the track“ Warning/Error should be sent in I007/030.
3. The value shall be within the range described by ICAO Annex 10
4. For Mode S, bit 15 (G) is set to one when an error correction has been attempted.

dataitem.name: Mode-C Code and Code Confidence Indicator
dataitem.definition: Mode-C height in Gray notation as received from the transponder together with the confidence level for each reply bit as provided by a MSSR/Mode S station.

field.name: QXi
field.desc:
= 0 High quality pulse Xi
= 1 Low quality pulse Xi

dataitem.desc:
Encoding Rule:
This data item is optional.
When used, it shall only be sent when a not validated or undecodable Mode C code has been received. For Mode A/C, it represents the confidence level for each reply bit of the Mode C code of the plot. For Mode S, if this item is sent because of an undecodable Mode-C code received in a Mode S altitude reply, all pulse quality bits will be set to high (zero).
NOTES
1. For Mode S, D1 is also designated as Q, and is used to denote either 25ft or 100ft reporting.
2. For Mode S, bit-31 (G) is set when an error correction has been attempted.

dataitem.name: Height Measured by a 3D Radar
dataitem.definition: Height of a target as measured by a 3D radar. The height shall use mean sea level as the zero reference level.

field.name: 3D-Height
field.desc: 3D height, in binary notation. Negative values are expressed in two’s complement LSB = 25 ft

dataitem.name: Radial Doppler Speed
dataitem.definition: Information on the Doppler Speed of the target report.

field.name: CAL
field.desc: Calculated Doppler Speed, coded in two’s complement LSB= 1 m/sec

dataitem.name: Radar Plot Characteristics
dataitem.definition: Additional information on the quality of the target report.

subfield.name: SSR Plot Runlength

field.name: SRL
field.desc: SSR plot runlength, expressed as a positive binary value. LSB=360/2^13° (0.044°)

subfield.desc:
NOTE
The total range covered is therefore from 0 to 11.21°.

subfield.name: Amplitude of (M)SSR Reply
subfield.desc:
NOTE
Negative values are coded in two’s complement form.

subfield.name: Primary Plot Runlength

field.name: PRL
field.desc: Primary Plot Runlength, expressed as positive binary value LSB= 360/2^13° (0.044°)

subfield.desc:
NOTE
The total range covered is therefore from 0 to 11.21°.

subfield.name: Amplitude of Primary Plot

field.name: PAM
field.desc: Amplitude of Primary Plot LSB= 1 dBm

subfield.desc:
NOTE
Negative values are coded in two’s complement form.

subfield.name: Difference in Range between PSR and SSR plot
subfield.desc:
NOTES
1. Negative values are coded in two's complement form.
2. The covered range difference is +/- 0.5 NM.
3. Sending the maximum value means that the difference in range is equal or greater than the maximum value.

subfield.name: Difference in Azimuth between PSR and SSR plot
subfield.desc:
NOTES
1. Negative values are coded in two's complement form.
2. The covered azimuth difference is +/-360/2^7 = +/- 2.8125°.
3. Sending the maximum value means that the difference in range is equal or greater than the maximum value.
Encoding Rule:
This data item is optional.
When used, all secondary subfields are optional.
Recommendation: For a combined target report, subfields RPD and APD of primary subfield should be present.

dataitem.name: Time of Day
dataitem.definition: Absolute time stamping expressed as Co-ordinated Universal Time (UTC).

field.name: Time-Of-Day
field.desc: Acceptable Range of values: 0 ≤ Time-of-Day ≤ 24 hrs = 2^-7 seconds = 1/128 seconds

dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. The time of day value is reset to 0 each day at midnight.
2. Every radar station using ASTERIX should be equipped with at least one synchronised time source

dataitem.name: Track Number
dataitem.definition: An integer value representing a unique reference to a track record within a particular track file.

dataitem.name: Track Status
dataitem.definition: Status of monoradar track (PSR and/or SSR updated).

field.name: DOU
field.desc: Signals level of confidence in plot to track association process
field.enum: Low confidence in plot to track association.

field.name: TRE
field.enum: End of track lifetime(last report for this track)

field.name: SUP
field.desc: Track maintained with track information from neighbouring Node B on the cluster, or network

field.name: TCC
field.desc: Type of plot coordinate transformation mechanism:
field.enum: Tracking performed in so-called 'Radar Plane', i.e. neither slant range correction nor stereographical projection was applied.
Slant range correction and a suitable projection technique are used to track in a 2D.reference plane, tangential to the earth model at the Radar Site co-ordinates.

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
RAD can change after a number of non-matching with TYP in item 020.

dataitem.name: Calculated Track Velocity in Polar Co-ordinates
dataitem.definition: Calculated track velocity expressed in polar co-ordinates.
dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The calculated heading is related to the geographical North at the aircraft position.

dataitem.name: Track Quality
dataitem.definition: Track quality in the form of a vector of standard deviations.

field.name: Sigma (X)
field.desc:
Standard Deviation on the horizontal axis of the local grid system (LSB) = 1/128 NM
NOTE - The standard deviation is per definition a positive value, hence the range covered is : 0 ≤ Sigma(X) < 2 NM

field.name: Sigma (Y)
field.desc:
Standard Deviation on the vertical axis of the local grid system (LSB) = 1/128 NM
NOTE - The standard deviation is per definition a positive value, hence the range covered is : 0 ≤ Sigma (Y) < 2 NM

field.name: Sigma (V)
field.desc:
Standard Deviation on the ground speed within the local grid system (LSB) = (2^-14) NM/s = 0.22 Kt
NOTE - The standard deviation is per definition a positive value, hence the range covered is : 0 ≤ Sigma (V) < 56.25 Kt

field.name: Sigma (H)
field.desc:
Standard Deviation on the heading within the local grid system (LSB) = 360/(2^12) degrees = 0.08789 degrees
NOTE - The standard deviation is per definition a positive value, hence the range covered is : 0 ≤ Sigma (H) < 22.5 degrees

dataitem.name: Aircraft Address
dataitem.definition: Aircraft address (24-bits Mode S address) assigned uniquely to each aircraft.

field.name: AIRCRAFT ADDRESS
field.desc: 24-bits Mode S address, A23 to A0

dataitem.name: Communications/ACAS Capability and Flight Status
dataitem.definition: Communications capability of the transponder, capability of the on-board ACAS equipment and flight status.

field.name: COM
field.enum: Comm. A and Comm. B capability
Comm. A, Comm. B and Uplink ELM
Comm. A, Comm. B, Uplink ELM and Downlink ELM

field.name: STAT
field.enum: No alert, no SPI, aircraft airborne
No alert, no SPI, aircraft on ground
Alert, no SPI, aircraft on ground
Alert, SPI, aircraft airborne or on ground
No alert, SPI, aircraft airborne or on ground

dataitem.desc:
Encoding Rule:
This item shall be present in every ASTERIX record conveying data related to a Mode S target. If the datalink capability has not been extracted yet, bits 16/14 shall be set to zero.

dataitem.name: Aircraft Identification
dataitem.definition: Aircraft identification (in 8 characters) obtained from an aircraft equipped with a Mode S transponder.

field.desc: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 bits each) defining target identification when flight plan is available or the registration marking when no flight plan is available.

dataitem.name: Mode S MB Data
dataitem.definition: Mode S Comm B data as extracted from the aircraft transponder.

field.name: MB Data
field.desc: 56-bit message conveying Mode S Comm B message data

field.name: BDS1
field.desc: Comm B Data Buffer Store 1 Address

field.name: BDS2
field.desc: Comm B Data Buffer Store 2 Address

dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. For the transmission of BDS20, item 240 is used.
2. For the transmission of BDS30, item 260 is used.
3. In case of data extracted via Comm-B broadcast, all bits of fields BDS1 and BDS2 are set to 0; in case of data extracted via GICB requests, the fields BDS1 and BDS2 correspond to the GICB register number.

dataitem.name: ACAS Resolution Advisory Report
dataitem.definition: Currently active Resolution Advisory (RA), if any, generated by the ACAS associated with the transponder transmitting the report and threat identity data.

field.name: MB Data
field.desc: 56-bit message conveying Mode S Comm B message data of BDS Register 3,0

dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. Refer to ICAO Draft SARPs for ACAS for detailed explanations.

dataitem.name: Directed Interrogation Request Number
dataitem.definition: Directed Interrogation Request Number

field.name: PRI
field.enum: Normal Priority, surveillance function has priority
High Priority, Directed interrogation has priority over surveillance

dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. The Request Number is created by the client, which directs the sensor to perform an interrogation.
2. The sensor will use the same request number for all subsequent messages related to the respective directed interrogation.
3. The sensor will not accept a request number which is currently processed.
4. In some cases (e.g. overlapping of directed interrogation windows with partially equal mode combinations) the sensor cannot determine which request number to assign to target reports due to ambiguity. In this case one matching request number will be used and the sensor has to generate an "ambiguous acknowledge" message when accepting the command.
5. A value of 0 for the Request Number will cause an Interrogation reject by the sensor. Therefore the Request Number shall always be greater than or equal to 1.

dataitem.name: Directed Interrogation Message Type
dataitem.definition: Directed Interrogation Message Type
dataitem.desc:
Notes
1. Using the Acknowledge the sensor will confirm the receipt of the directed interrogation command.
2. After the sensor has completed the interrogation, i.e. the interrogations are transmitted, the sensor will report an Interrogation Finished message.
3. When no further targets for a directed interrogation are expected, an Interrogation Completed message will be issued by the interrogator.
4. Although each Directed Interrogation should result in exactly one target report, cases may occur resulting in error conditions. These potential error conditions are signalled with item I007/030.

dataitem.name: Directed Interrogation Window
dataitem.definition: Geographical window defined in polar co-ordinates
dataitem.desc:
Notes
1. When present, this window defines the area which should be interrogated and for which target reports are expected.
2. The sensor shall use this window to determine the azimuth range for the directed interrogation.
3. The sensor may use this window to tag the extracted targets within this window with the request number.
4. In case multiple request windows overlap, the sensor may respond with an Ambiguous Acknowledge. It shall be noted, that internally generated expectation windows for directed interrogations related to targets/tracks may also lead to Ambiguous Acknowledge Responses.
5. The target window is meant within a NE related coordinate system with the point of origin at the radar head.

dataitem.name: Directed Interrogation BDS Register Request
dataitem.definition: Directed Interrogation BDS Register Request

field.name: BDS1
field.desc: (BDS1) Comm B Data Buffer Store 1 Address

field.name: BDS2
field.desc: (BDS2) Comm B Data Buffer Store 2 Address

dataitem.desc:
NOTES
A Directed Interrogation BDS request will only be performed once. If it is not successful it will not be repeated automatically but has to be re-ordered.

dataitem.name: Directed Interrogation Result
dataitem.definition: Directed Interrogation Result

subfield.name: Truncation

field.name: T
field.desc: interrogation scheduler has truncated the All Call request

field.name: A
field.desc: interrogation scheduler has activated the request at least once

field.name: C
field.desc: interrogation scheduler has activated the request during all its validity

subfield.desc:
NOTE
Details about potential truncation of interrogations can be found in STANAG 4193 Part V, § 3.2.5.

field.name: M4_NB
field.desc: Number of Mode 4 Interrogations performed for the request

field.name: M5_NB
field.desc: Number of Mode 5 Interrogations performed for the request

field.name: LO
field.enum: No Lockout used by Interrogation Scheduler

field.name: MS_NB
field.desc: Number of Mode S All Calls performed for the request

field.name: MX_NB
field.desc: Number of Mark X Interrogations (Mode 1,2,3/A,C) performed for the request

field.name: SMS_NB
field.desc: Number of Selective Mode S Interrogations performed for the request
